data.title: Syntax highlight bug in .tsx files around < >
Hard to place caret before first character of line by mouse

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.0 (e724f269ded347b49fcf1657fc576399354e6703, 2016-07-07T16:52:42.674Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Using default dark+ theme (but others are affected likewise)
2. Open any file and place caret before first character of any line with spaces as indentation
3. -> It is hard to hit the right spot right of the folding ruler and left of the first character

We seem to be missing a visual indicator where the line begins. A simple workaround is to add a editor.ruler at column 0 in the settings.

data.title: Coffeescript syntax grammar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

Hello, you're adding new syntax grammar for javascript from atom grammar, maybe you're converting atom coffeescript grammar? He is awesome, and many people used coffeescript in projects.

data.title: Ctrl+D should match whole words instead of substrings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Is there a way to highlight matching whole words of the word under cursor instead of all substrings?
In VScode, the current behaviour:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1718745/16674113/084a0e54-4483-11e6-8688-d69751d427aa.png)
What I want (as seen in Sublime):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1718745/16674149/4b82ab18-4483-11e6-8c60-537b28b32d7c.png)
This is actually the default behaviour in Sublime Text and IntelliJ based IDEs.

data.title: Fixes #7346: Paste native EOL
Exploration
Freezing linux
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.0 (e724f269ded347b49fcf1657fc576399354e6703, 2016-07-07T16:50:12.291Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.2.0-040200-generic

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start VScode
2. Open a PHP file
3. Within a minute of looking around in the file, the whole machine freezes - need to restart to fix it.

I think it was an issue in 1.2.1 as well, but only happened maybe once a week. Now it happens within minutes.

Further information, running linux from encrypted USB drive.

data.title: [powershell] Incorrect Powershell Parsing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.0 (e724f269ded347b49fcf1657fc576399354e6703, 2016-07-07T16:56:12.476Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create new file
2. Name it TEST.ps1
3. Add this text
   $c.'#text'
   SHOULD NOT BE MARKED AS STRING
   'SHOULD BE MARKED AS STRING
4. VSCode incorrectly parses the text.
   The second line should not be shown as a string.
   The third line should be shown as a string
5. Paste same text in the ISE to compare

data.title: Toggle Control Characters doesn't work in 1.3.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.0 (e724f269ded347b49fcf1657fc576399354e6703, 2016-07-07T16:50:12.291Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 3.19.0-32-generic

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Menu View -> Toggle Control Characters
2. You get `No handler found for the command: 'editor.action.toggleRenderControlCharacters'. An extension might be missing an activation event.`

data.title: Add shortcuts to select different tabs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

This is a feature request to default `CMD + 1` to go to the first tab, `CMD + 2` to go to the second tab and so on...

The current behaviour seems unusual as it splits the editor into 2 or 3 sections. Also, similar shortcuts from `CMD + 4` to `CMD + 9` are not utilised.

data.title: [sql] Incorrect interpertation of a backward slash in single quotes ( '\' vs '\\' ) in sql files.
data.body:
When viewing sql code (*.sql) if you have a backward slash in single quotes (sql1) the app will consider anything else after it (till the end of the code) to be comments. If you add a second backward slash within the single quotes (sql2) it will interpret it an an esc char and defined it as \ but the sql program will output two backward slash \

![sql1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20346405/16672383/a9c4f826-445a-11e6-89ff-54bd2469e550.jpg)
![sql2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20346405/16672384/a9cabe64-445a-11e6-96f2-b6559f6f805a.jpg)
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version:          win 7 ent SP1
1. 
2.

data.title: Issues with error splash bar.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: Win 10 Ent Version 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open some js file in VS Code
2. Make sure you have ESLint package installed and no .eslint in project folder.
3. Start typing something in the editor and getting an error splash with no way to close it.
4. See attached gifs for more info.

![81cc716aa315476b1d714ae3b2ac6486](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/795984/16672488/19f5fd30-44af-11e6-9f03-44fc9a840373.gif)

data.title: return 'supportsVariableType' == true for `InitializeRequestArguments`
data.body: for details see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/41

data.title: Suggestion: add @installed filter to Extensions View

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
To keep parity with @outdated, @popular and @recommended, we could add @installed.  We can still have the cleared search box show installed but I think users might expect that @installed would work.

It actually would help explain the installed extension list which is currently displayed without any clarification, just the "Search Extensions in Marketplace" prompt.

See also https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8856

data.title: Suggestion: Change command to Show Recommended Extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insiders
- OS Version:Windows

The rest of the Extension: commands in the Command Palette and Extensions View dropdown say "Show blah Extensions".  Saying "Show Extension Recommendations" doesn't fit with the others.

I get it wrong all the time in the docs.:-) 
The filter is "@recommended" as well.

data.title: Fixes #8617: Use native EOL sequence
Fixes invisible cursor in long editor lines
data.body:
The problem lies somewhere in browser rendering optimization,
in case when the translate3d is turned off everything
works correctly.

fixes #8828

data.title: Fixes mousewheel zoom in case of inline diff view
data.body:
The problem is that the diff viewer does not updates the
font size on the view zones - e.g. deleted lines - when the
editor configuration changes.

Fixes #8778

data.title: Try chjj/pty.js@0.3.1
data.body: The new version might make the fork unnecessary.

data.title: Honour the optional `endLine` and `endColumn` attributes of `StackFrame` and `Breakpoint`
data.body: If a StackFrame or a Breakpoint has an optional end location, show the character range instead of the full line.

data.title: Let me configure whether to autocomplete single quotes in comments
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a Python file (really, any language will do, I just happened to be using Python today). Add a commented-out line.
2. Type the word don't. Two apostrophes are inserted instead of one. 

When I'm writing a comment, I'm more often using a single quote as an apostrophe in a word,
rather than writing a string or character literal. If I really want a pair of them in a comment, I'm OK typing two of them. I should be able to configure whether to auto-complete single quotes in comments.

data.title: ES6 class member not showing in Intellisense
Integrated terminal doesn't open in workspace folder
data.body:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open folder
2. Open integrated terminal
3. -> Opens in C:\Windows instead of the opened folder

data.title: 1.2.1 OSX El Cap: Reopen loop after copying to Applications folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: fe7f407b95b7f78405846188259504b34ef72761
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download VSCode 
2. Decompress
3. Copy result to Applications folder

Result: App gets stuck in a loop: "This window has crashed: Close, Reopen". Selecting Reopen results in a loop. 

App runs fine if I don't copy to Applications folder.

data.title: Editor layout not preserved on restart
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0 Stable
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a markdown file
2. right click on the tab, open preview
3. drag preview to the right to create a second editor well
4. restart VS Code

Result: the markdown preview is not opened and i only have one editor well
